editor.rest

Class VoidRestService

  • java.lang.Object
    • editor.rest.VoidRestService

  • public class VoidRestService
extends java.lang.Object
    Restful service to create, show and download VoID dataset description created.
    Author:
    Lefteris Tatakis

    • Method Detail

      • postVoidCreation

        public java.lang.String postVoidCreation(VoidAttributes data)
        Creates a temporary VoID file in order to display users their current progress.
        Parameters:
        data - The information captured from the user.
        Returns:
        The VoID file created in a String in order to be shown in the "Under the Hood" functionality.

      • getVoidFile

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getVoidFile()
                                      throws org.openrdf.rio.RDFParseException,
                                             org.openrdf.rio.RDFHandlerException,
                                             uk.ac.manchester.cs.datadesc.validator.rdftools.VoidValidatorException,
                                             java.io.IOException
        Given all the appropriate user data, it creates a fully validated VoID dataset description that can be used in the OPS project.
        Returns:
        A file which will be downloaded by the users. This file is a validated and correct VoID dataset description.
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.rio.RDFParseException
        org.openrdf.rio.RDFHandlerException
        uk.ac.manchester.cs.datadesc.validator.rdftools.VoidValidatorException
        java.io.IOException

      • uploadFile

        public org.json.simple.JSONObject uploadFile(java.io.InputStream uploadedInputStream)

        Translates the VoID the users upload to the UI into a JSON Object. This object is then used by AngularJS to fill in the information.

        Parameters:
        uploadedInputStream - An old VoID dataset description the users wish to update.
        Returns:
        JSON Object that contains the information provided in the file uploaded by the user in a usable format.

      • uploadUserDataFile

        public org.json.simple.JSONObject uploadUserDataFile(java.io.InputStream uploadedInputStream)
        Uploading an RDF data file for statistical analysis.
        Parameters:
        uploadedInputStream - RDF data the user want statistical analysis done on.
        Returns:
        JSON Object containing Stats.

      • uploadOPSSources

        public void uploadOPSSources(java.lang.Object sources)
        This method retrieves the OPS Sources for OPS API, in order to be able to decode the URIs provided in an uploaded VoID.
        Parameters:
        sources - The Sources that are retrieved from the OPS API.

      • sparqlEndpointStatsUniqueObjects

        public org.json.simple.JSONObject sparqlEndpointStatsUniqueObjects(java.lang.String endpoint)
        Parameters:
        endpoint - The sparql endpoint the user wants to be statistically analysed.
        Returns:
        JSON Object containing Unique Objects.

      • sparqlEndpointStatsTotalTriples

        public org.json.simple.JSONObject sparqlEndpointStatsTotalTriples(java.lang.String endpoint)
        Parameters:

      • validateVoid

        public java.lang.String validateVoid(VoidAttributes data)
        API service to check if the created VoID is correctly validated by OPS Validator.
        Parameters:
        data - The user input from the UI.
        Returns:
        The result produced by the OPS Validator.
